thread.title: 6 brilliant moments that prove the magic of the FA Cup is still very much alive as the fifth round ties get underway
thread.title_full: 6 brilliant moments that prove the magic of the FA Cup is still very much alive as the fifth round ties get underway

author: Jake Polden
title: 6 brilliant moments that prove the magic of the FA Cup is still very much alive as the fifth round ties get underway
text:
Sport 6 brilliant moments that prove the magic of the FA Cup is still very much alive as the fifth round ties get underway From Sutton fans celebrating the Arsenal draw to Wolves players clapping the supporters after beating Liverpool - this is what it's all about Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Fans show that the magic of the FA cup is still alive Share this video Get football updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
The magic of the FA Cup is an old cliche. 
It's what you'd expect to hear from your grandad, who would explain to you why football's oldest cup competition is the ultimate prize. 
Today the lure of European football, the money, and the global advertising it brings, is the be-all and end-all of the game, and as a result managers pay less attention to the FA Cup. 
But that doesn't mean to say the spark has been completely diminished, especially among the teams in the lower divisions, when they get the chance to play on a big stage. Wycombe Wanderers players react to drawing Tottenham (Photo: Twitter/@wwfcofficial) Sutton United fans' go wild when they draw Arsenal in the fifth round (Photo: BBC) 
In the above video, we have complied together some of the greatest moments of the competition so far, although it's a work in progress. 
We've go a feeling there's even more just around the corner... 
So far there has been the way the Wycombe Wanderers players celebrated drawing Tottenham in the fourth round. Lincoln City celebrate reaching the last 16 of the FA Cup for the first time in 115 years (Photo: Getty) Wolves defender Richard Stearman celebrates scoring against Liverpool at Anfield (Photo: Getty Images) 
The way Sutton fans celebrated drawing Arsenal in the fifth round. 
And of course, the way National League Lincoln City celebrated drawing Championship Brighton... before beating them to reach the last 16 for the first time in 115 years. 
Brilliant!
